column3: Agency Name (Full name of agency or sub-agency) Ex: Department of the Interior
column4: Unit Affected (Specific office, program, or division affected) Ex: "National Park Service"
column5: Date Announced (Date layoff was announced) Ex: 11/5/2025
column6: Effective Date (Date layoff went into effect) Ex: 11/5/2025
column7: Region Affected (FIPS code for state and/or county) Ex: 27053
column8: Reason Provided (Official rationale or source language) Ex: Budget
column10: Data Source( URL or title of primary document/source) Ex:"FOIA"
column13: Hiring Type (Type of federal service position) Ex: Senior Executive
column14: Employment Status (Status of original employment) Ex: "Career, Probationary, Temporary, Contract, Mix, or Unknown"
column15: Union Representation (Whether employees were union-represented) Ex: 0 = No Representation
column16: Function Affected (OPM occupational series code that describes the primary function of the affected role(s)) Ex: 0018
column17: Capability Loss Narrative (Narrative summary of lost capabilities) Ex: "NIOSH?s ability to conduct mine hazard tracking in WV significantly reduced"
column18: Criticality (Clarifying whether roles are frontline or administrative) Ex: 0 = Admin Support/Backend
column19: Backfill Strategy (Planned or actual response) Ex: "Partial reassignment to another program"
column20: Expertise Loss (Type of specialized knowledge lost) Ex: "Toxicology", "Field Epidemiology"
column21: Program Delivery (Projected possibility for ongoing program delivery) Ex: Poor, Average, Strong
column22: Notes (Free-text notes or context) Ex: "Staff reductions will halt two multi-year studies on silicosis"
column23: Data Confidence (Confidence in the validity of source) Ex: High, Medium, Low
column27: Approve? (THIS MAKES THE ROW'S DATA LIVE)
